body.p: Here you can change what aspect ratio you want to have on the result, thus constraining the proportion of width and height of the crop rectangle to the aspect ratio of your choice. Many common numerical ratios are pre-defined. A few special aspect ratios deserve explanation:

row.entry: free forming the rectangle without any ratio restrictions
this option constrains the ratio to be equal to image ratio
this option constrains the ratio to be equal the golden number
this option constrains the ratio to be 1

body.p: You can also select any other ratio after opening the combobox and typing it in the form of x:y. If you want a certain aspect ratio to be added to the pre-defined ones you can do so by including a line of the form
into darktable's configuration file $HOME/.config/darktable/darktablerc. Here foodefines the name of the new aspect ratio and xand ythe corresponding numerical values.
